page.title: 16BALMACARA HOUSE
page.content: Balmacara House is a very old building on the shores of Lochalsh.The building must be about 200 or more years old.It was owned by a family called Lillingston until they sold the Estate and built a smaller private house in the vicinity. It was then leased by a gentleman called Lord Blysthwood who came there for his holiday every summer.It was worked at all winter by two old ladies from the village.After Lord Blysthwood's death, it was taken over by Sir Daniel Hamilton who had bought Balmacara Estate. After his death Balmacara House was bequeathed to Ross-shire Education Authority as a boys' agricultural college.Following that it is now leased out to the Royal Navy. They have done a lot of alterations which is a big improvement.
